title: Friends icons Matt LeBlanc, Courteney Cox and Jennifer Aniston reunite
text:
We’re halfway to a full reunion guys! (Picture: Instagram)

Courteney Cox is the gift that keeps on giving when it comes for Friends nostalgia and now we’re just hoping and praying she can get that full reunion we’ve been dreaming of.

In the meantime, she’s still hanging out with her old sitcom buds one-by-one, stretching out the show’s 25th anniversary celebrations as long as she can.

After spending the special day itself having a dinner party with Lisa Kudrow (who played Phoebe) as well as Charlie Puth and Judd Apatow, Courteney became host for two more friends – Jennifer Aniston (Rachel) and Matt LeBlanc.

Underneath, she wrote: ‘A rare night and I love it.’

Looks like Courteney is the real-life Monica of the group, keeping in touch with all of her former co-stars and throwing parties (that we’re totally jealous we’re not invited to).

Unfortunately over the past few months there’s never been more than three friends around at the same time – with Matthew Perry currently in recovery for addiction struggles, and David Schwimmer spending time in the UK filming new series, Intelligence.

Friends celebrated its 25th anniversary last month (Picture: NBC/NBCU Photo Bank via Getty Images)

But whenever Courteney does get to check in with her pals – especially her leading ladies Jennifer and Lisa, it’s always made our hearts glow.

Their lives were changed forever in September 1994, when Friends first came to prominence, and the cast made sure to share their thanks at the ever-lasting legacy the show created.

While Jennifer and Matthew Perry (Chandler) don’t have Instagram, the rest of the group, completed by David Schwimmer (Ross) posted the same photo in a sign of unity after all these years.

We’ll be over hear re-watching Friends for the millionth time (Picture: Jon Ragel/NBC/NBCU Photo Ban)

Walking down the street in suits and gowns, the gang are seen beaming and holding flowers.

Underneath her version of the photo, Lisa said: ‘We might be in different places but we are connected #StillThereForYou.’

Aaaaand now we’re crying.

Friends is available to watch on Comedy Central and stream on Netflix in the UK.
